You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Rename, Copy, or Delete a Storefront

View a list of all your storefronts and easily rename, clone, delete, or create a storefront.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To edit custom objects:	Customize Application

Consider cloning and modifying an existing storefront, or creating a separate storefront, when:

You want guest buyers to have access to a different set of records—products, promotions, themes, and so on—than your registered buyers. To support this use case, create one storefront for guest buyers, and another storefront for registered buyers.
You require different checkout workflows for different groups of buyers. For example, maybe one group of buyers only has access to digital products, where shipping information isn't required. But, another group of buyers has access to physical products, where shipping information is required.
Your extensions of default behavior behave differently for different groups of buyers. As the complexity of your use case increases, the complexity of your extension code also increases. For example, maybe one group of buyers has a different set of cart validation rules before they're allowed to check out. It can be easier to support these different scenarios with separate storefronts.
TIP To simplify the work required to set up a storefront, we recommend that you clone an existing storefront instead of creating a blank one.
Navigate to the options for managing your storefronts.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Global Settings (1).
In the Global Settings menu, select Storefronts (2).
Select the action that you want to complete for a particular storefront:
ACTION	USE CASE	CONSIDERATIONS
New (3)	Create a blank, uniquely named storefront in your org with no configuration data or custom settings.	The new storefront inherits your org's B2B Commerce for Visualforce global settings. But, the new storefront doesn't include any storefront custom settings (such as configuration settings, general settings, and integrations) or storefront data (such as products, categories, and price lists).
View (4)	View a storefront’s custom settings in CC Admin.	—
Edit (5)	Rename a storefront.	—
Clone (6)	Copy an existing storefront's configuration data and custom settings to a new, uniquely named storefront.	The new storefront inherits your org's B2B Commerce for Visualforce global settings and the original storefront's custom settings (such as configuration settings, general settings, and integrations). But, the new storefront doesn't include the original storefront's data (such as products, categories, and price lists).
Delete (7)	Remove a storefront, its configuration data, and its custom settings from the org.	—
TIP When you create, rename, or clone a storefront, the new storefront name can't include any spaces and can't exceed 16 characters.
If you cloned or created a storefront, add the new storefront as a value for the Storefront field picklist on the following custom objects:
CC Coupon
CC Featured Product
CC Price List
CC Product
CC Promotion
CC Shipping Rate
CC Term
Find the settings for the object where you want to update the Storefront picklist values.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select the object, such as CC Coupon.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select the object, such as CC Coupon.
Find the Storefront field on the custom object.
In Lightning Experience, scroll to Fields & Relationships, and select Storefront.
In Salesforce Classic, scroll to Custom Fields & Relationships, and select Storefront.
Scroll to the Values section, and click New.
Enter the name of the storefront, and click Save.
IMPORTANT Enter the exact storefront name that you previously created.
Repeat these steps for each affected custom object.
If you cloned or created a storefront, clone other records that you want to use for the new storefront, such as menus and page sections.
If you cloned or created a storefront, optionally configure the new storefront as your org's default.
In the Global Settings menu, select Settings (8).
For Default Storefront (9), enter the exact storefront name that you previously created.
Click Save (10).
SEE ALSO
Create Associations between Multiple Storefronts and Experience Cloud Sites
Salesforce Help Add or Edit Picklist Values

title: Renaming, Cloning, Deleting a Salesforce B2B Commerce Storefront
